page.title: 09Southam Churches
page.content: Christian worship is catered for in Southam with three consecrated church buildings, Our Lady and St. Wulstan Catholic Church, St. James Parish Church and the Congregational Church. There is a Free Church held in the Community Centre. There are two places of worship in Stockton. The Catholic church was built in 1925 and it is made of brick. It serves 21 villages and there are masses during the week and three at the weekend. The church has a convent attached to it. The Congregational church is also made of brick and was built in 1839. Services are held on Sundays. St. James church is built of stone. It has many stained glass windows. There is a clock and a weather cock on the spire. All the churches join together for ecumenical services from time to time.
